intro: Meconopsis atrovinosa, commonly known as the black violet, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its striking dark purple to black flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
